alert.note: Alert for Habersham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 10:30AM EST until January 04 at 11:31AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding continues following rainfall overnight and early this morning. * WHERE...A portion of Habersham County near the Soque River. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Sam Pitts Park in Clarkesville is likely partially flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1030 AM EST, gauge reports indicated the Soque River is near minor flood stage. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area and the river may rise slightly before beginning to recede. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the past 24 hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clarkesville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
